cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 110 mi (175 km) SE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Racing west-northwest across the central Caribbean; expected to slow, then arc northwest across central/western Cuba on Monday and turn north-northeast toward the Florida Peninsula and the southeast U.S. coast mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central or western Cuba (near Camagüey-Granma coastline)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A — watches confined to Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba and parts of the Caribbean
weather_observation.warning_coast: N/A — warnings confined to Hispaniola, Jamaica, Cuba and parts of the Caribbean
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Caribbean islands, then Florida Peninsula, Georgia and the Carolina coasts through mid-week
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late 7 Jul–8 Jul (generally <34 kt)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected at Delaware River / upper Delaware Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate rain could bring 1–2 inches as Elsa’s remnant low passes nearby on 8 Jul
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor, short-lived river rises and reduced visibility may briefly disrupt cargo handling
